name: Averis Corporate Business Responsive WP Theme

sections.title: Install
sections.content:
This chapter will give you detailed instructions on how to install WordPress and setup the theme with all its options and demo content.

 

0. Quick Agenda

  • (Install WP)
  • Download Averis from Themeforest
  • Unzip downloaded file
  • Upload unzipped Averis folder to installed WP
  • Activate via WP Backend

 

1. Install WordPress on your server

  • You will need to do a WordPress installation on your server. There are several ways of doing this. The easiest (in my opinion) is the following:
  • Download the WordPress installation files here http://wordpress.org/download/
  • Extract the files and upload them to a directory on your server using a ftp program. Example: http://yourserver/wordpress
  • Next, just type the path to this folder into your browser url bar. Example: http://yourserver/wordpress
  • Follow the on screen instructions until you have fully installed WordPress on your server (you will need your server sql login data)
  • You can find more information and guides on WordPress installation here: http://codex.wordpress.org/Installing_WordPress

 

 

2. Install the Averis WordPress Theme

  • Extract (Important!) the themeforest package you recieved to any folder on your harddrive. The archive contains several folders. You will need to upload the "averis" folder which contains the theme data to your wordpress installations theme folder on your server. Example of a destination folder: http://yourserver/wordpress/wp-content/themes/ The resulting file structure will look like this: http://yourserver/wordpress/wp-content/themes/dragon/
  • Please set the file permissions like you think is best (when you know what you are doing:). Otherwise please use 755 for all folders and 755(644) for all files (ask your provider/host to help you if needed). (Important!)
  • Next go to your WordPress installation admin panel

    » appearance » themes

  • You will see the Averis theme listed. Press

    » activate

  • You will find the "Averis Options" to be opened now. At the bottom of that frame you see "First Steps after Activation". Please follow the instructions and come back here.
  • All what is missing in your theme now are sidebar widgets! Please take a look at the wdget section of the documentation.
  • Important Note: The folders functions/temp and functions/cache in the theme folder need to have write access rights on your server, otherwise automatic thumbs cannot be generated! If you miss pics on the pages please use less restrictive permissions here.

If you have a menu already in use please check that it is named "Main"! (Important!)

sections.title: Averis Options
sections.content:
Options Overview

The Averis custom options panel can be found in the wordpress admin under the "Averis" tab. Options are separated into different categories to give you a better overview over all available options.

Note that when making any changes to the options, you need to click "Save All Changes" at the top or the bottom of the dragon options panel.

  • Layouts

    Choose from 4 pre defined Layout skins to take as base for your personal custom Averis version.

  • Design

    The basic design choices are to be found in this tab

  • Typography

    Choose your Google font here (or change the font-family to whatever you like). Enter the sizes of the different text elements like Headings or normal content.

  • SEO & Analytics

    Enter global SEO content and activate the Special SEO enhancement. Here is the place where you could put in your Google Analytics code aswell.

  • Header

    Things in the header can be defined here like the Site logo and appearence/content of different head elements.

  • Contact


    Define the important fields of your contact page.

  • Footer

    Same as the header section all important footer elements can be turned on and off here or filled with content.

  • Blog

    Turn on or off certain elements of the blog over- and detail view.

  • Portfolio

    Turn on or off certain elements of the blog over- and detail view..

  • Support & Help

    Find how to contact our Support Team! Basically open a ticket at http://themepunch.ticksy.com :)

  • First Steps After Activation

    You probably read that already. The first things to do after Theme activation.

» Pages » All Pages

...you can add/edit/remove pages in your theme. If you imported the theme data like described in the documentation (which you should if you are a beginner) you will see a list of the demo pages as seen in the preview.

First you should choose between our  page templates eg. "content","portfolio"(overview) or "blog"(overview).




All of them have the same Head information set (they differ from what settings you choose or enter, you will only see what is really needed), Example:

sections.title: Posts
sections.content:
In the wordpress admin panel under

» Posts » All Posts...

...or...

» Portfolio "..."»Portfolio "..."

...you can add/edit/remove post to the blog or your portfolio of choice. If you imported the theme data like described in the documentation (which you should if you are a beginner) you will see a list of the demo posts as seen in the preview.

First thing to do should be to set a proper "Featured Image" even if you are planing to do a Video post or else. This way the post will be seen in all widgets/shortcodes/overviews that deal with posts (or projects). Choose the fullsize to fit all sizes later (the theme will calculate that for you).




You have the same Head Information part as the Pages that will show and hide settings parallel to your main choices here, example:




Then choose the post type and corresponding things will be asked, Example of a Video Post here (the width are needed for responsive means):




If you choose your post to be of the "Slider" type you can choose between the sliders you created. See that part later in this documentation.

sections.title: Sliders
sections.content:
Sliders

This section is related to the...

» Averis » Sliders

...Sliders can be used in all projects and posts. Especially present is the slider on the home page.

Home Page Option:



Post/Portfolio Type:




In the slider manager you can build and edit sliders. When you open the Slider Manager you will find a fresh, empty slider you could build further and save.

But you can also load existing ones by changing the value in the top left selectbox. In the Head area you can set a lot of options concerning the current choosen slider. See our two example sliders for the best options for the Head Area ("Home Slider" slider) and for the post type ("Blog Slider" slider).



No insert your slider images and captions with the buttons you find. Clicking on the main image or the caption position fields you can drag&drop the captions on the screen to its needed position. The slides are drag&dropable too to change their position inside the slider queue.

sections.title: Widgets
sections.content:
Available Custom Widgets

  • averis Archives

    This widget displays the archives of the blog.

  • averis Categories

    This widget displays the categories of the blog with post count per category.

  • averis Mini Gallery

    A mini gallery you can use to show a grid of images in the footer or sidebar widget area.

  • averis Popular/Latest Posts

    You can show a selectable number of posts from the blog here.

  • averis Latest Projects

    You can show a selectable number of Portfolio projects here.

  • averis Sidebar Vimeo Video

    Show a vimeo video with this widget. Note to only add the vimeo video id NOT the whole link to the video.

  • averis Sidebar Youtube Video

    Show a youtube video with this widget. Note to only add the youtube video id NOT the whole link to the video.

  • averis Twitter Feed

    A twitter feed widget. You can select the number of tweets you want to show.

sections.title: Localization / Words
sections.content:
This theme comes with .mo and .po files and is ready for localization! Note that most of the steps that lead to a localized theme are not related to this theme specifically but are general information.

  • I would highly recommend that you install the free plugin "CodeStyling Localization" which makes localizing and adding new languages very comfortable.

  • On this page you can get a link for your language that allows you to download files that turn your wordpress installation (the non theme files) into your desired language. You need the .mo and .po files for your language (Example link for german version here)
  • There core wordpress .mo and .po files you downloaded go into your wp-content/languages folder.
  • In the root of your wordpress installation you will find the wp-config.php file. Open it and change define ('WPLANG', ''); to reflect your country language code, e.g.: define ('WPLANG', 'de_DE');.
  • When going to the localization plugin under...
    » Tools » Localization
    ...you will see the Dragon theme when you scroll down. You can customize the available languages (Deutsch/English) or add your own language.
  • After adding a new language, hit "Rescan" so the plugin can go through the theme files and get all the custom language fields.
  • Clicking "Edit" you can then translate those language fields.

  • Via...

    » Settings » General

    ...you can also set the themes "Time Format" which is used throughout the theme.
